abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings summary for the Justice
            Services Improvement Project in Peru are as follows:
            Outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            low or negligible, bank performance was satisfactory and
            borrower performance was satisfactory. One overarching theme
            or impact from this Project has been the inter-institutional
            coordination and collaboration that it has fostered across
            the sector. When the Project began, these participating
            agencies barely dealt directly with each other to resolve
            sector issues, choosing instead to fight it out in the
            press. Today, with the support of the Project, these
            agencies (through technical staff as well as the agency
            heads) have reached out to each other, and even joined
            forces to show unity in their request to the Ministry of
            Economy and Finance for a next phase. It is a noteworthy
            impact that the Project has contributed to the maturity of
            the sector and its development in this regard. One of the
            Projects important achievements can be found under
            Component 3 which financed a National Program on Legal
            Education for Social Inclusion (PRONELIS) Programa Nacional
            de Enseñanza Legal para la Inclusión Social) through support
            to the Ministry of Justice (MINJUS). While a follow-on
            project reflects a strong commitment of the key agencies, an
            important lesson learned is the need to have better
            communicated the Projects outputs. The achievements of this
            Project have largely been seen or felt by agency staff
            themselves or at the local level of users in communities.
            Information campaigns and greater outreach to the public at
            the national level to reach potential users of justice
            services could have further strengthened reform efforts in
            the sector. The use of greater public outreach to share the
            outcomes of the Project with Peruvian society is a related
            lesson in this sense.
